intro: Phegopteris hasseltii, commonly known as the silver fern, is a fern species native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive fronds with a silvery underside. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. Its leaves are bi-lobed and have a leathery texture, which helps it retain moisture. Phegopteris hasseltii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
